intro: Cyclosorus warmingii, commonly known as the Warming's water fern, is a rare aquatic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Marsileaceae and is characterized by its small, floating leaves that form a rosette shape. The plant has four leaflets that are often described as resembling a four-leaf clover. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments and is adapted to low light conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
